title: Stalemate (The Accident)
coachIntro: You have cornered the enemy, but if you forget to leave him one square to breathe, you do not win. This is stalemate.
summary: Learn how to avoid stalemating a lost King, and how to use stalemate as a last resort when you are losing.

tasks.prompt: You are completely winning with Queen and King against a lonely King. One careless move is stalemate. Choose the move that keeps winning.
tasks.successMessage: Good. You left him one square—to step into his grave next move.

tasks.prompt: White to move. One move is stalemate, another is checkmate. Find the checkmate.
tasks.successMessage: Yes. Do not settle for half a point when you can take the whole point.

tasks.prompt: You are losing badly. There is no way to win—but there is a stalemate trick. Find the move that makes it impossible for your opponent to move without checking you.
tasks.successMessage: Well done. If you cannot win, you must make sure you do not lose.

tasks.prompt: You are winning, but almost all moves stalemate the enemy King. Find the only move that keeps winning.
tasks.successMessage: Excellent. Sometimes the quiet move is the only way not to throw everything away.

tasks.prompt: You are down material and your King is trapped in the corner. One sacrifice will force stalemate. Find it.
tasks.successMessage: Bravo. You turned a loss into a draw. In the tournament, this saves money.
